snippet: The activist hedge fund manager William A. Ackman bet a billion dollars on the collapse of the nutritional supplement company Herbalife, then launched an extraordinary campaign to hasten that development.
abstract: William A Ackman, activist hedge fund manager of Pershing Square Capital Management, has undertaken extraordinary political campaign to destroy nutritional company Herbalife, against which he has placed a $1 billion bet; Ackman has exerted significant pressure on lawmakers to investigate company, organizing protests, news conferences and letter-writing campaigns in a number of states; effort illustrates how Washington has become a battleground for financial titans whose interest in public policy is limited to personal gain.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT, ERIC LIPTON and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

lead_paragraph: The activist hedge fund manager William A. Ackman bet a billion dollars on the collapse of the nutritional supplement company Herbalife, then launched an extraordinary campaign to hasten that development.

headline.seo: Staking $1 Billion That Herbalife Will Fail, Then Lobbying to Bring It Down
headline.main: After Big Bet, Hedge Fund Pulls the Levers of Power
headline.print_headline: After Big Bet, Hedge Fund Pulls the Levers of Power
